articles.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
articles.description: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. It stated that very heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Bihar on August 28. It added that Uttarakhand may witness very heavy rainfall on August 28 and 29. Further, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness rainfall with heavy falls till August 29.

articles.title: Why are the over 300-ft-tall twin towers in Noida being demolished?
articles.description: The Supertech Twin Towers in UP's Noida will be demolished on Sunday after a nine-year-long legal battle. The towers were found to be in violation of multiple construction and fire safety rules by the Allahabad High Court in 2014. In 2021, the Supreme Court upheld the HC ruling and ordered their demolition. The towers are 338 and 318 feet tall.

articles.title: Disney Star bags ICC media rights for Indian market till 2027
articles.description: The ICC has confirmed Disney Star will be the home of all ICC cricket in India for next four years after winning the TV and digital rights to both men's and women's global events till 2027. Disney Star won following a single round sealed bid process. "They'll play a crucial role in...future of our sport," ICC Chair Greg Barclay said.

articles.title: Mars is not entirely red: NASA
articles.description: Often referred to as the 'red planet', Mars is not entirely red, NASA's Perseverance Rover has found. As it arrived at Mars' Jezero crater, it spotted volcanic rocks that are green, scientists said. These rocks are composed of "large grains of olivine, the muddier less-gemlike version of peridot that tints so many of Hawaii's beaches dark green", NASA stated.

articles.title: Feeling great: India's 16-yr-old Chanambam on becoming judo world champion
articles.description: After she became the first-ever Indian judoka to win a gold medal at Cadet World Championships 2022, 16-year-old Linthoi Chanambam said she's feeling absolutely great. "I'll try my best to win a medal at 2024 Paris Olympics. But, if not in Paris, I'm sure I can do it at 2028 Olympics," she added. Chanambam became world champion in 57-kg category.

articles.title: Hardik Pandya is a huge addition to the side: Ganguly
articles.description: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya is a "huge addition" to the Indian team for the Asia Cup. "Last year, he (Pandya) was not fit to bowl, now he's gone back to bowling," Ganguly said. The former Indian skipper added, "No team is a favourite in the T20 format. Did anyone think of Gujarat winning the IPL?"

articles.title: Not forming alliance with any party for Assembly polls: Meghalaya CM
articles.description: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma on Saturday said the National People's Party (NPP) will not form an alliance with any party for the upcoming Assembly elections in the state. Sangma added that the party would also contest the upcoming Assembly polls in Odisha and Chhattisgarh on its own. Elections in Meghalaya are likely to be held early next year.

articles.title: Woman and her wife set greatest height difference record of a married couple in US
articles.description: Christie Chandler and Senecca Corsetti, who hail from St George, Utah, bagged the Guinness World Record for the greatest height differential of a married couple (same sexes/women). Christie, who stands at 5 feet 11.74 inches, is nearly 3 feet taller than her wife Senecca, who measures 3 feet 2.29 inches. Senecca has a form of dwarfism known as diastrophic dysplasia.

articles.title: Mood in Team India camp is buzzing: Rohit ahead of Asia Cup game vs Pakistan
articles.description: Ahead of India-Pakistan group stage match at Asia Cup 2022, India captain Rohit Sharma said his side just wants to focus on their game. "The mood in the camp is buzzing. What has happened is [in the] past...We haven't decided on playing eleven. We'll look at the pitch and decide accordingly," he added. The match will be played on Sunday.

articles.title: Rajasthan man being taken to court jumps off bus; dies
articles.description: A man died after he jumped off a bus while being taken to a court in Churu, Rajasthan. The deceased, Pramod Kumar (38), jumped off from the rear gate of the bus in a bid to escape, police said. Pramod was arrested under IPC sections for harassment for dowry, criminal breach of trust, voluntarily causing hurt and cheating.

articles.title: He became free: Scindia on Ghulam Nabi Azad quitting Congress
articles.description: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said Ghulam Nabi Azad has "freed" himself by resigning from the Congress. "The internal situation of the Congress has been clear for many years now. But in the end, Ghulam Nabi ji became free," said Scindia, who joined BJP from Congress in 2020. Azad ended his five-decade-long association with the party on Friday.

articles.title: Just Sul to make cameo in Salman's 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'
articles.description: Social media influencer Just Sul will make a cameo appearance in Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. Sul's official spokesperson confirmed the news to Pinkvilla. Abdu Rozik, the world's smallest singer from Tajikistan, will also appear in the film. Abdu said he's nervous and excited about his Bollywood debut.

articles.title: Don't worry, world's best team on it: Noida towers' demolition team chief to residents
articles.description: The manager of the team demolishing the Noida Supertech Twin Towers has said while he understood the concerns of the residents near the building, they shouldn't be afraid. "The best team in the world is working on the project," said Jigar Chheda of Edifice Engineering on Saturday. The demolition, scheduled for Sunday, will be completed in 12 seconds, Chheda said.

articles.title: Congress promises 'Janata Dawakhanas' with free healthcare in Guj
articles.description: Similar to the AAP's mohalla clinics, Congress has promised 'Janata Dawakhana' (public clinics) to give free medical treatments in its Gujarat election manifesto. The party added that government hospitals and government-approved hospitals in the state would conduct liver, heart and kidney operations for free. Apart from this, the party has promised policies to maintain the sex ratio in society.

articles.title: I was brash, I wasn't mature enough: Virat Kohli on being called 'brash'
articles.description: In a recent interview, ex-India captain Virat Kohli said he was a guy who was looked at as brash. He added, "I was [brash]. I wasn't mature enough...but I was true to myself. I never wanted to...be someone else." He stated, "In this recent phase...I tried to keep up to expectations and not really felt my inner being completely."

articles.title: I didn't touch the bat for a month for the first time in 10 years: Virat Kohli
articles.description: Talking about his break from cricket ahead of Asia Cup, Virat Kohli said he didn't touch the bat for a month for the first time in 10 years. "I came to the realisation that I was kind of trying to fake my intensity a bit recently...but your mind was telling you to take a break and step back," he added.

articles.title: CCTV footage shows Sonali Phogat being forcibly given spiked drink hours before death
articles.description: A day after security camera footage showed Sonali Phogat struggling to walk out of a nightclub in Goa, hours before her death, a new clip has emerged that shows her being forced to drink on the dance floor. The man in the video appears to be Sudhir Sangwan, one of her two associates named as accused in her murder case.

articles.title: Pics show J'khand CM, UPA MLAs taking boat ride near Latratu dam
articles.description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren and UPA MLAs, who shifted to Khunti district on Saturday to reportedly avoid poaching attempts, were seen taking a boat ride near Latratu dam later in the day. The CM's sister-in-law Sita Soren was also seen riding a boat. Pictures from the scene were shared online. Heavy police force was seen near the dam.

articles.title: PM Modi spins charkha alongside 7,500 women at 'Khadi Utsav' in Guj
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi began his two-day visit to Gujarat by attending the 'Khadi Utsav' at the Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad on Saturday. In pictures that have surfaced online, he is seen spinning a 'charkha' (spinning wheel) alongside 7,500 women Khadi artisans. "In the upcoming festivals...gift only the products made by Khadi and Village Industries," the PM appealed to citizens.

articles.title: Conceived it as love story of white man & Indian woman: Aditya on DDLJ
articles.description: Aditya Chopra, director of Broadway musical based on 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', said, "I first conceived...DDLJ as...love story of white...man and Indian woman." He said he wanted to present Indian culture to global audience, adding, "As I reimagine the story, my mainstay is still the same." The makers were criticised for casting an American actor as male lead in musical.

articles.title: I'm being severely harassed: Pregnant professor accuses JNU of harassment
articles.description: A JNU assistant professor, who is eight months pregnant, has accused the university administration of "insulting, harassing and intimidating" her. "I'm being severely harassed and punished continuously physically, mentally and socially," Gayettri Dixit alleged. "Due to the atrocities by the administration, I fell unconscious at my university residence and was rushed to the...hospital," she added.

articles.title: In last 8 yrs, all projections of Finance Ministry are below target: Swamy
articles.description: BJP member Subramanian Swamy commented on Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's projection of 7.4% growth for the Indian economy for the next two years. "In the past 8 years, all projections of the Finance Ministry are hugely off the mark, and below the stated target...[Notably], the GDP growth rate [has] declined year after year since 2016," Swamy tweeted.

articles.title: Varanasi suffers flooding as Ganga levels breach danger mark
articles.description: River Ganga's water levels crossed the danger mark by 10 am on Saturday, leading to more than 80 villages in UP's Varanasi being affected by floods. District administration said 18 municipal wards have been affected and more than 228 hectares of crops have been damaged. Officials added that more than 10,000 flood victims have been relocated to relief camps.

articles.title: Cong a 'sinking ship', Azad raised valid issues during exit: Fadnavis
articles.description: Reacting to Ghulam Nabi Azad's exit from the Congress, BJP leader and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday called the Congress a "sinking ship". "I think some questions raised by Azad were valid," Fadnavis said. "However, it is their internal matter and I will not comment on it," Fadnavis added.

articles.title: 2 men arrested for killing labourer in South Delhi's Saket
articles.description: Delhi Police on Saturday arrested two men for allegedly killing a 44-year-old labourer in south Delhi's Saket area earlier in the week. On Thursday, police received information from Max Hospital, Saket, that Arvind Sah, a resident of Pushp Vihar, was declared brought dead. Later it was found the deceased was assaulted by three to four persons on Wednesday night.

articles.title: It's internal matter of Cong: MoS Jitendra Singh on Azad's resignation
articles.description: After Ghulam Nabi Azad quit the Congress, Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh said that it is an internal matter of the party. "It is important to follow democratic principles in a political party," Jitendra Singh said. "If it is not being followed, then the party's people should be worried about it," he added.

articles.title: 4 of a family killed, 1 injured as SUV skids off road in Shimla
articles.description: Four members of a family were killed and one person was injured after their SUV skidded off the road, rolled down and hit the bed of a rivulet in Shimla district. Eight members of the family were on their way to attend a family function, police said, adding the driver lost control while trying to avoid collision with a motorbike.

articles.title: 2 BSF jawans rape woman trying to cross Indo-B'desh border, arrested
articles.description: Two Border Security Force (BSF) personnel have been arrested for allegedly raping a woman near the Indo-Bangladesh border in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas, a senior official said on Saturday. The suspects have been suspended and a court of inquiry has been ordered against them. The woman was caught while allegedly trying to illegally enter Bangladesh, the official added.

articles.title: 1 dead, another hurt as unidentified man opens fire in South Delhi
articles.description: One man was killed and another was injured after an unidentified man shot them in south Delhi's Neb Sarai area, officials said on Saturday. Police were alerted of the shooting on Friday night and they found blood marks and six empty cartridges on the road near Raju Park in Devli. The deceased, Kapil Panwar, received eight bullet injuries, police said.

articles.title: Huge traffic jam on B'luru-Mysuru highway as lake overflows amid rain
articles.description: Massive traffic jam was reported on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway after Kanmanike lake overflowed and flooded the highway on Saturday due to recent rainfall. Police said passengers were stuck in traffic for over four hours. As per reports, a road connecting Mysuru highway to a village in Ramanagara collapsed after the lake overflowed and a newly-constructed toll booth almost submerged in water.

articles.title: 17-yr-old booked for abandoning newborn, boyfriend arrested in Mumbai
articles.description: A 17-year-old girl was booked for allegedly abandoning her newborn in a tempo in Mumbai's Nallasopara. Her 21-year-old boyfriend, who impregnated her, was also arrested. The baby was found by a resident who was walking his dog on Thursday morning. The CCTV footage of nearby areas showed the girl and her family members putting the baby in the tempo.

articles.title: Indian discus thrower Navjeet Dhillon fails dope test, banned for 3 years
articles.description: Indian discus thrower Navjeet Dhillon, who had bagged a bronze at CWG 2018 and had participated in CWG 2022, has been banned for three years by Athletics Integrity Unit for failing a dope test. The 27-year-old tested positive for a metabolite of dehydrochloromethyltestosterone (DHCMT). Dhillon stated she consumed DHCMT unknowingly as it was part of a supplement she was using.

articles.title: Will completely study HC order on Bengaluru's Eidgah: Karnataka CM
articles.description: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the state government will completely study the Karnataka HC's order on the Eidgah Maidan in Bengaluru. "Everyone's wishes need to be fulfilled while maintaining peace...We will hold a meeting...on implementing it [order]," CM Bommai said. The court has modified its interim order and has now allowed religious and cultural activities on the ground.

articles.title: He needs to score runs not only for India but for himself: Sourav Ganguly
articles.description: Talking about Virat Kohli ahead of Asia Cup, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "He needs to score runs not only for India but for himself." Ganguly added, "Hopefully, it'll be a good season for him. We all are confident that he'll come back." "It's not possible that players of his stature can't have such a long lean patch," he stated.

articles.title: UP will soon be ahead of all in terms of new generation infra: Rajnath Singh
articles.description: Mentioning how Uttar Pradesh is developing under the "double engine" government, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the CM Yogi Adityanath-led state will soon be ahead of all others. "The way infrastructure work is being done in Uttar Pradesh, it's definite...the state will be ahead of all the states in terms of new generation infrastructure in coming days," he said.

articles.title: Rohit Sharma asks Babar Azam to get married, video of their chat goes viral
articles.description: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has shared a video of Team India captain Rohit Sharma interacting with Pakistan captain Babar Azam. In the video, Rohit can be heard asking Babar to get married. "Nahi, abhi nahi (No, not now)," Babar answered. Their interaction took place at a training ground in Dubai ahead of India-Pakistan's clash in Asia Cup 2022.

articles.title: NASA's Rover finds 'rocks shaped by water' on Mars
articles.description: NASA has said its Perseverance Rover has found that the floor of the Jezero Crater is made up of "rocks that have interacted with water". Scientists had expected to find sedimentary rocks at bottom of the Crater which held a lake billions of years ago, NASA said. But instead, they found two types of igneous rocks, it added.

articles.title: Army rescues Hungarian trekker in J&K after 30-hour-long search op
articles.description: An Indian Army team rescued a 38-year-old Hungarian national, who had lost his way in Umasi La in the Himalayan ranges while trekking, from Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district after a 30-hour-long search operation. The man was later airlifted by the Indian Air Force (IAF) to Udhampur for treatment. "I am thankful to...everyone involved in the search operation," he said.

articles.title: Maha CM gets stuck in traffic as vehicles breakdown, block Pune road
articles.description: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's convoy was stuck in traffic briefly on Friday evening after a truck and a car broke down and blocked the highway near Chandani Chowk in Pune. The Pimpri Chinchwad Traffic Police rushed to the spot, cleared the congestion and helped Shinde's convoy pass through a third lane. The convoy was halted in traffic for 15 minutes.

articles.title: Azad's resignation letter might be authored by someone else: DK Shivakumar
articles.description: Congress leader DK Shivakumar has said that Ghulam Nabi Azad's resignation letter might have been "authored" by "someone else in another party". "If you see the first two pages [of Azad's resignation letter], he has only written about the number of positions...in the last 47 years that the Congress party has given him," Shivakumar said.

articles.title: Panel probing Jayalalithaa's death submits report to TN government
articles.description: The Justice Arumughaswamy commission constituted to probe late Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's death, submitted its findings to the state government on Saturday. Justice Arumughaswamy said only the state could publish the 500-odd page report and the outing has been "satisfying" for him. The AIADMK government constituted the commission after the CM died on December 5, 2016.

articles.title: 23-yr-old man held for stealing bikes in Mumbai, 4 bikes recovered
articles.description: A 23-year-old deaf youth with a speech disability, Dinesh Kumar Ramlal, was arrested for allegedly stealing motorcycles in Mumbai. The incident came to light after the accused was caught by the traffic police riding a stolen bike without a helmet in Colaba on August 22. In the last six months, he stole four two-wheelers, which were recovered, police said.

articles.title: Doesn't matter if Bumrah, Harshal are unavailable vs Pak at Asia Cup: Anjum
articles.description: Anjum Chopra said it doesn't matter if players like Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel are unavailable in Team India's squad against Pakistan at Asia Cup 2022. "India have so many options. The selectors can pick from a bench strength of 25 players, probably even more," she added. Jasprit (back injury) and Harshal (rib injury) were ruled out of Asia Cup.

articles.title: Don't want to be compared: Nikhil on 'Karthikeya 2' outdoing 'Laal...'
articles.description: Actor Nikhil Siddhartha has reacted to his film Karthikeya 2's comparisons with 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' after it performed better than the Hindi films at the box office. Nikhil said, "I don't want to be compared because Karthikeya was...standalone film, we've done this with a lot of heart...So the minute you compare it...you're not doing justice to it."

articles.title: What are the benefits that former CJI NV Ramana will get after retirement?
articles.description: After retirement, former CJI NV Ramana will get a chauffeur and a secretarial assistant for one year from the date of retirement. He shall be entitled to security cover round the clock at residence in addition to round the clock personal security guard for one year. He'll also get rent-free accommodation in Delhi for six months from date of retirement.

articles.title: PMC to file review petition in SC for Parvati hillock plot
articles.description: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to file a review petition in the Supreme Court after the court directed the PMC to hand over a 16-acre plot at Parvati hillock to its owner. The PMC took possession of the land after offering 4% compensation, as per the Hilltop and Hill Slope policy. The land owner has sought 100% financial relief.

articles.title: Super excited to see Federer again on court: Nadal ahead of Laver Cup 2022
articles.description: Speaking about Roger Federer's return to tennis at upcoming Laver Cup 2022, Rafael Nadal stated that he's excited to see the 20-time Grand Slam champion again on court. "I hope he's healthy enough to make that happen...Has been a long period of time without Roger on court," he added. Federer hasn't played since his quarter-final loss at Wimbledon 2021.

articles.title: Two small town, middle-class outsiders: Vivek as he shares pic with Kartik
articles.description: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with actor Kartik Aaryan. "Two small town, middle-class, outsiders from Gwalior who made it on their own terms," he captioned the post and added, "If you are a young Indian, be inspired by a down-to-earth, rooted and exceptionally talented Kartik Aaryan."
